abstract.p: Miami Beach city commissioner Nancy Liebman letter responds to May 28 front-page article on hedonistic society in Miami Beach, Fla (M)

block.p: ''Beauty Reigns Supreme in a Florida Enclave'' (front page, May 28) depicts a hedonistic society in Miami Beach littered with wannabe models and devoid of books, jobs, a real life or a clean beach.

Here's a real snapshot of the city: Most of our citizens send their children to our six public schools; visit the city's three museums; attend the resident symphony and ballet companies; enjoy the botanical garden; browse the galleries of local artists on Lincoln Road; and spend time in refurbished local parks. We are expanding the Bass Museum and building a new library.

Here's a real snapshot of the city: Most of our citizens send their children to our six public schools; visit the city's three museums; attend the resident symphony and ballet companies; enjoy the botanical garden; browse the galleries of local artists on Lincoln Road; and spend time in refurbished local parks. The scene you describe is but a trivial element of the society, missing the real substance of Miami Beach's beautiful lifestyle.
NANCY LIEBMAN Commissioner, City of Miami Beach Miami Beach, May 29, 2000
